summary: This is an FBI Electronic Communication summarizing an interview conducted on January 23, 2007, with a former chauffeur/butler/house manager for Jeffrey Epstein in Palm Beach, Florida. The interview details Epstein's daily routines, financial arrangements, the presence of young females at his residence, and the roles of his associates, including Ghislaine Maxwell, in facilitating his activities.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the federal investigation for sexual exploitation of minors. Described as a very private individual who received daily massages, had many young female companions, and directed his staff in specific tasks related to his lifestyle.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.role: Epstein's associate, described as his girlfriend and personal assistant
persons.context: Traveled everywhere with Epstein. Initially believed by the witness to be Epstein's girlfriend, but she would take a separate bedroom when other females were present. The witness also thought she tried to find females for Epstein.

persons.name: David
persons.context: Mentioned as an employee whose salary, along with the witness's, was paid from Epstein's New York office. Last name is unknown (LNU).

persons.name: Louella
persons.context: Hired by the witness to clean Epstein's residence. Her salary was paid by the witness. Last name is unknown (LNU).

persons.name: Jerome
persons.context: The gardener at Epstein's residence, paid by the witness. Last name is unknown (LNU).

connections.description: Maxwell was Epstein's personal assistant who traveled everywhere with him. The witness initially believed she was his girlfriend, but noted she took a separate bedroom when other females were present and may have helped find females for him.
Epstein employed David as a chef. David's salary was paid from Epstein's New York office.
Epstein's household employed Louella as a cleaning lady, hired by the witness.
Epstein's household employed Jerome as a gardener, paid by the witness.

events.title: Witness begins employment with Epstein
events.description: The witness was hired as a Chauffeur/Butler/House Manager for Jeffrey Epstein at his Palm Beach residence in August or September 2004.

events.title: FBI Interview of Epstein's former employee
events.description: The FBI interviewed a former chauffeur/butler/house manager for Jeffrey Epstein in Palm Beach, Florida, regarding a federal investigation into the sexual exploitation of minors.

keyFacts: A former employee of Jeffrey Epstein stated he believed some of the local girls visiting Epstein's Palm Beach residence were underage, citing delivering flowers to a girl at Royal Palm Beach High School and girls carpooling together.

Epstein's daily routine included receiving massages, for which the employee was sometimes instructed to pay the masseuses $300-$400 from petty cash. The employee wore gloves when cleaning up the massage area afterward.
Ghislaine Maxwell was described as Epstein's personal assistant who traveled everywhere with him and was believed by the employee to also try to find females for Epstein.

Epstein maintained strict control and privacy: the employee was not allowed to address him directly, had to contact his assistant in New York or Maxwell, and had to place fanned-out $100 bills and a concealed gun near his bed before his arrival.

The employee's duties included acting as a 'human ATM,' keeping large amounts of cash on hand, renting vehicles for young females, and taking them shopping or for flying lessons at Epstein's direction.
